intro: Echinochloa frumentacea, commonly known as false rice, is an annual grass species native to tropical and subtropical regions. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and narrow, grass-like leaves with a prominent midrib. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences bearing numerous tiny, white to pale green flowers. It is often found in wetland areas, rice fields, and disturbed soils, making it a common weed in agricultural settings. Its rapid growth and adaptability contribute to its success in various environments.
